text:
I can't delete jar file which is used to define tasks. This jar file is created
during build process and after all I need to delete it. 
On all other OS it OK. It is OK in Ant 1.3 too.
creator: michal.zlamal@sun.com

text:
What are the other things you do in between creating this jar and deleting it?
Are there any tasks that use the generated jar file in some fashion?  I need
this to understand where the problem is.
Can you try creating a target which creates a jar and deletes the jar 
immediately with no other tasks in between?  If this works, then you need to 
find the real task that causes the problem.
creator: umagesh@apache.org

text:
When I create jar and inmediatly after it I try to delete it - it is OK. There
is no problem.

This jar file contains classes used as ANT tasks and between creating and
deleting it I define them. No other task can use this jar file.
If you want the real date you can download the sources of NetBeans -
http://www.netbeans.org.
Cvs acces is cvs.netbeans.org:/cvs with user anoncvs which have empty password.
The affected file is our main build.xml file (nbbuild/build.xml) target real-clean.
creator: michal.zlamal@sun.com

text:
Ok.  I reproduced the problem using this snippet:
<javac srcdir="." destdir="." classpath="foo.jar">
    <include name="Bar.java"/>
</javac>
<delete file="foo.jar"/>

For now, please use javac in fork mode.  It will not fail then.  I will 
meanwhile see what can be done for it to work in the unforked mode too.

Magesh
creator: umagesh@apache.org
